title: Pittsfield police investigate weekend shooting; Boy, 17, shot in torso
content:
PITTSFIELD - Police are investigating a weekend shooting on North Street that left a 17-year-old boy with a gunshot wound to the torso, police said.
Police were dispatched to the area of 391 North St just before 11:30 p.m. Friday for reports of gunfire.
The first officers on scene found a boy who had just been shot. He was taken to the hospital and at last report is listed as stable but in critical condition, according to police.
His name was not disclosed to the press.
The shooting is being investigated by the Pittsfield police Detective Bureau, the Drug Unit and Crime Scene Services.
Anyone with information about the shooting is asked to contact the Detective Bureau at 413 488-9708. Information may also be left anonymously via that department's Drug Tip Hotline at 413-448-9708.
People may also text a tip via a cell phone by addressing a text message to "TIP411 (847411) and beginning the message with "PITTIP".
